publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3188 Jackie Baillie: Robin House—That the Parliament congratulates the Children’s Hospice Association Scotland (CHAS) on the completion of Robin House in Balloch in August 2005; recognises that Robin House will be a welcome addition to parents and children in the west of Scotland and will see an enhanced capacity for 300 children and their families between Robin House and Rachel House in Kinross; commends the commitment and effort of the fundraisers and staff involved in the creation of this vital hospice; notes that CHAS is currently running a consultation, one aim of which is to develop appropriate funding structures for the future, and encourages the Scottish Executive to assist where possible in providing funding to secure this national resource. Supported by: Donald Gorrie*

S2M-3188 Robin House (lodged on 24 August 2005) Shona Robison*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Margaret Jamieson*, Michael McMahon*, Tricia Marwick*, Campbell Martin*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Alex Neil*, Nora Radcliffe*, Murray Tosh*, Patrick Harvie*, Robin Harper*, Rob Gibson*, Mr David Davidson*, Bruce Crawford*, Bill Butler*, Brian Adam*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Alex Fergusson*, Michael Matheson*, John Swinburne*, Cathie Craigie*, Phil Gallie*, Tommy Sheridan*, Frances Curran*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Miss Annabel Goldie*, Mrs Mary Mulligan*, Mr Jim Wallace*, Christine Grahame*, Mr John Swinney*
S2M-3188 Robin House (lodged on 24 August 2005) Susan Deacon*, Helen Eadie*, Linda Fabiani*
S2M-3188 Robin House (lodged on 24 August 2005) Eleanor Scott*, Ms Wendy Alexander*
S2M-3188 Robin House (lodged on 24 August 2005) Trish Godman*
